definitions: To push or pull (a railroad car or train) from one track to another; to switch.
To move or turn aside; to divert.
To avoid or get rid of (something undesirable); to fob off.
To provide (an electric current) with a shunt.
To divert (blood or other fluid) through a shunt.
examples: They will shunt the train to track three.
The company tried to shunt responsibility onto a subcontractor.
The surgeon will shunt blood around the blockage.
